snippet: Mario Draghi acknowledged, however, that a plan to tax small bank deposits was “not smart, to say the least.” The central bank left interest rates unchanged at 0.75 percent.
abstract: European Central Bank head Mario Draghi rejects suggestions that Cyprus could benefit from giving up euro, while acknowledging that plan to tax small bank deposits in country was mistake.

byline.original: By MELISSA EDDY and JACK EWING
byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy reported from Frankfurt and Jack Ewing from London. Julia Werdigier contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Mario Draghi acknowledged, however, that a plan to tax small bank deposits was “not smart, to say the least.” The central bank left interest rates unchanged at 0.75 percent.

headline.seo: Draghi Dismisses Any Nation’s Move to Drop the Euro
headline.main: E.C.B. Chief Says Cyprus Shows Commitment to Euro
headline.print_headline: Central Banker Dismisses Any Move to Drop Euro
